posts.author: Salbar
posts.content:
Hello,
I am new here and still totally inexperienced with pulling a build out of a top hat, would very much be appreciated if I got set straight here so I dont have to worry myself about anything.

I am looking for a build for a Goblinoid on the Amia PW for RPing and surviving as a rogue/sneaky individual so I might end up being self-reliant most of the time. But I need aid on this.
The weapon of choice would be the shortsword, since its a good pick. No ranged weaponry will be used. Would like to mix it up by having stealth and regular non-stealth fighting open. Since HiPS has a 6 second CD on the server.
Shortsword dual-wielding if possible. Main focus stat would be for DEX with some of the base stats upped for an increase for saves?

I know its a tough order but if some things need to be sacrificed to keep it well rounded and still fun to play, I'm all game.

These are the stats for the goblin. I know it removes Halfling bonuses but I'll have to live with that.

Goblin
Favoured Class : Rogue

Abilities: -2 Strength, +2 Dexterity, -2 Charisma;
Skills: +4 Discipline, +4 Move Silently;
Feat: Darkvision;
Appearance: Goblin;
Racial Type changes to Goblinoid;
Halfling bonuses removed

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
It seems like you can use almost any halfling build here since rogue is favored class for both races, and the dex bonus and str penalty are the same. Avoid classes that rely on charisma, like bard, sorcerer, or charisma based divine feats.
If goblin is small stature (and I think it must be), you should not dual-wield anything bigger than daggers.

posts.author: Salbar
posts.content:
Ah, okay.

Do you know any that was made for the Amia PW or atleast with Roleplay in mind, besides stabbing things from the shadows.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey Saibar! At first glance I would say that to turn that into a level 30 build, you need to go with Rogue 20 Fighter 4 CoT 6 and get rid of some combat feats. Maybe even consider not dual-wielding (that alone saves you 3 feats). That's pretty much the only way I see this build reduced 10 levels. Then you can go with Shortsword / Large Shield (which you would unequip during stealth and equip after you show yourself). That would give you durability to fight toe-to-toe and versatility to attack from the shadows.

Take it EZ!
